_header: Mother of God and Virgin undefouled
Note: Perhaps originally a triad of twenty-one stanzas.
_description: ‘Mother of God’, attributed to Hoccleve — twenty stanzas rhyme royal

BodArcSelB24.First Lines:
Moder of god and virgyne vndefouledO blisfull quene of quenys
                    Emperice…
BodArcSelB24.Last Lines:
…Be In my hert now and euermoreAnd of my saule wesche away the
                    sore

Boffey,  Julia,  and  A. S. G. Edwards, eds.  
             Chaucer, Works. Bodleian Library MS Arch Selden B.24: Facsimile
                Edition.
         Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1995.

NLS1828.First Lines:
Moder of god and virgin wndefouldO blisfull quene oure quenis
                    emperice…
NLS1828.Last Lines:
…Be in my hert now and euermoreand of my soule wesch away the
                    sore

HunHM111.First Lines:
Modir of god and virgyne vndeffouledO blisful queene of queenes
                    Emperice…
HunHM111.Last Lines:
…Be in myn herte now and euermoreAnd of my soule wasshe away
                    the sore
